intro: Quercus jucunda, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the fall. It produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Quercus jucunda typically grows in dry to moist forests and thrives in well-drained soils.
